lines.text: [Bill Haley walks up to a table with Arnie Haines and Alan Freed]
How we doin', Dad, the newspaper gal diggin' us?
Yeah, real deep. She sounds like she has us plowed way under already.
Yeah, and I always thought that freedom of the press was a tailor who irons your suits for nothing. It shows you.
[everyone laughs a forced and phony laugh, and then they all get up and leave; Bill Haley looks offended]
He seems to think that running around in my underwear or getting thrown out of my hotel is news. And does that sound like news to you guys?
If you were Kim Novak, it might.
Well, we have a point to prove Mr. Everett. We'd like to show the rest of the country that Rock and Roll is a safe and sane dance for all young people.
It hasn't hurt me any, has it?
[after spilling liqour all over a dance]
What are you doin' bringin' liqour in here?
[he lifts up his fist; the other dancer pulls it down]
